alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 10:56PM EST until December 21 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, significant flooding to riverside businesses on the Kennebec and also on the Cobbosseecontee Stream. Water enters Water Street, also Route 27 or Route 201. At 22.0 feet, three feet of water at the corner of Water and Central Street in downtown Hallowell. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:36 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:36 PM EST Tuesday was 22.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage Thursday morning to 9.2 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
